page.title: 07OUR NEW SEA DEFENCES
page.content:
In 1982 we had a bad flood in Burnham when a combination of a very high tide and a strong west wind broke through the sea wall and caused a lot of damage. Our council decided that we needed a new sea wall which was begun in March 1984.
45 people are working on the wall altogether, and it is going to cost Â£6,000,000.
30,000 tonnes of concrete will go into the wall which has a series of steps from the beach and a high curved top to throw the waves back when the tide is high. There is an interesting pattern on the landward side of the wall which makes it more attractive for our visitors. The new wall will be higher than the old one, but we should still be able to see over it.
